questions.question_text: An engineer must connect a Cisco UCS appliance port directly to NFS and iSCSI storage devices. Which action should be taken to achieve this goal?

choices.D: Configure NFS and iSCSI to use the same VLAN tag on the appliance port.
choices.C: Configure the appliance ports in trunk mode and apply VLAN tagging on the storage.
choices.A: Configure the appliance ports in access mode and apply VLAN tagging on the storage.
choices.B: Configure VLAN tagging on the storage and the Cisco UCS simultaneously.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Cisco recommends that you configure the appliance ports in Trunk mode and configure the VLAN tagging on the storage side for maximum flexibility.

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/servers-unified-computing/ucs-5100-series-blade-server-chassis/116075-ucs-app-connectivity-tshoot-00.html#anc6

Selected Answer: BC
B, C are the right ones

Selected Answer: BC
B and C - because only the ingress traffic

questions.question_text: An engineer needs to implement a solution that will provide telemetry of MDS 9000 switches in a SAN fabric. The solution should use Cisco Data Center Network Manager (DCNM) with SAN Insights feature. Which three steps are required to deploy the solution? (Choose three.)

choices.A: Activate ENTERPRISE_PKG license on target switches.
choices.F: Configure name resolution between the devices.
choices.E: Activate SAN_ANALYTICS_PKG license on target switches.
choices.D: Select a target VSAN to be monitored.
choices.B: Select a target Fabric to be monitored.
choices.C: Select the target ports to be monitored for telemetry data.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BCE
The answer is correct.

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/switches/datacenter/sw/11_0_1/config_guide/san/b_dcnm_san/configure.html#task_fw1_g1y_pdb

Selected Answer: B
If you modify the device alias configuration, you need to commit or discard the changes as the fabric remains locked during this period.
B is the correct
D must the right answer, because the "device-alias commit" command run on global config mode, not inside mode.

comments.content:
You don't *need* to exit from device-alias database mode to do the commit. Yes it's a global configuration command but it doesn't "have to" be run in global config mode.
But it MUST be entered to commit the changes so B it is.

discussion.content: this is a very tricky question. however device-alias commit is required to save the config, but you need to exit from database first before you run that command. D is correct.

Selected Answer: B
B is correct

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. An engineer must configure a Fibre Channel device alias named TEST for a device attached to port fc1/9 of a Cisco Nexus Series Switch. Which command set completes the configuration?

An engineer requires the Cisco Fabric Services to distribute NTP configuration only to the members within the scope of a VSAN that belongs to a Cisco Unified Network. Which scope distribution must be selected to meet this requirement?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Correct.
"VSAN level (logical scope) - Applications that operate within the scope of a VSAN have the configuration distribution restricted to the VSAN."
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/switches/datacenter/nexus5000/sw/system_management/502_n1_1/b_Cisco_n5k_system_mgmt_cg_rel_502_n1_1/Cisco_n5k_system_mgmt_cg_rel_502_n1_1_chapter5.html#:~:text=Applications%20that%20operate%20within%20the,applicable%20only%20within%20a%20VSAN.&text=Logical%20scope%20is%20not%20supported%20for%20FCS%20distribution%20over%20IP.
